intro: Croton gardneri, commonly known as the African croton, is a tropical shrub native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, varied leaf colors, which range from green to red and yellow. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for both indoor and outdoor cultivation. Due to its ornamental value, it is often grown as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses.
